He devoted himself to farming and planting, practiced what was suitable for the land, crossed the Wei River from Qi and Ju, gathered timber for use. translations.english: The people wish to fight on my account, killing fathers and sons to make me their ruler - I cannot bear to do this.'

translations.english: Gong Ji followed Gu Gong's teachings, was devoted to practicing righteousness, and the feudal lords submitted to him.

translations.english: He treated worthies with courtesy; at noon he had no time to eat while waiting for scholars. Scholars therefore came to him in great numbers.

translations.english: King Zhou was greatly pleased and said: 'Even one of these treasures would be enough to release Xi Bo, let alone so many!'
